page.title: 04FARMING AROUND CALOW
page.content: Calow area is surrounded by farmland. Most of the land has crops that are not grassland,like wheat,barley,oats and oilseed rape. There is some grassland which is used for pasture for beef cattle,like Herefords, Simmentals,Charolais,for some Friesian dairy cows and a few sheep and horses. Some of this grass is cut for silage and hay to feed the cattle in the winter. On the farms there are small groups of trees and these are mainly deciduous. A small piece of land near Arkwright is used for allotments by the miners growing vegetables,fruit and flowers for their families.One or two people keep pigeons too.
